revised_title: GABA-Evoked Conductance Changes in Lobster Muscle Fibers
tldr: The authors measured the membrane conductance and capacity of lobster muscle fibers using a three-intracellular-microelectrode voltage clamp technique. They found that GABA increases the membrane conductance and decreases the effective capacity in a dose-related manner. The results suggest that GABA may selectively increase the conductance of cleft-tubular membranes in the muscle fibers.
